N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6500.7 - Application process and selection criteria

State Regulations
(a) Awards will be made through a request for
proposals. (b) The request for
proposals shall include the criteria upon which the awards will be
made. (c) Criteria for such awards
shall include, but are not limited to: (1)
the
ability of the faculty member to leverage and attract Federal funds, venture
capital and private industry funds; and
(2)
the willingness of the faculty member to
pursue entrepreneurial enterprises resulting in new business or the expansion
of business in New York State. (d) The applicant's response to the request
for proposals shall include the following minimum documentation: (1)
general applicant information; (2)
a demonstration of the applicant's
specific need for such funds and the manner in which such award would enhance
the research capabilities and reputation of the respective institution of
higher education; (3)
a narrative
description of the proposed project, its expected public benefit and economic
impact, the applicant's commitment to maintaining the project beyond the period
of State assistance and how the project conforms to NYSTAR's funding priority
for the cycle for which the application is submitted; (4)
profiles of the proposed recruited and/or
retained faculty member(s), including, but not limited to, education, employment history, publications, awards, areas of research, and experience
with emerging technology companies; (5)
a budget detailing the total cost of the
project, and the sources of the applicant's match; (6)
anticipated performance timelines for
initiating and completing the project; (7)
a statement of support of the applicant, which is executed by the president or chief executive officer of the applicant, and in a format approved by NYSTAR, recommending the application to NYSTAR and
authorizing an official of the applicant to execute documents necessary for the
project; and
(8)
such other
information as may be required by the executive director in order to implement
this program and to accommodate requirements arising from cyclical program
priorities. (e) Ratings
will take into account cyclical programmatic and funding priorities as
established by NYSTAR in consultation with the advisory council pursuant to
section 6500. 6 of this Part. Specific rating factors for each award cycle and
their relative weights will be available in the request for
proposals. (f) In addition to the
rating factors considered by the proposal evaluation team, the executive
director's award determination may take into account the past performance, if
any, of the applicant on previous projects administered by NYSTAR or its
predecessor, and other information relevant to determining whether the award is
in the best interests of the State and is consistent with the Jobs Two Thousand
for New York State (J2K) Act. Notes
